message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public static void iterative(List<int[]> list) {
    List<String> combinations = new ArrayList<>();
    combinations.add("");

    for (int[] array : list) {
        List<String> newCombinations = new ArrayList<>();
        for (String combination : combinations) {
            for (int i : array) {
                newCombinations.add(combination + i);
            }
        }
        combinations = newCombinations;
    }

    for (String combination : combinations) {
        System.out.println(combination);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses nested loops instead of recursion. The outer loop iterates over each array in the list. For each array, it creates a new list of combinations by appending each element of the array to each existing combination. The new list of combinations replaces the old one. Finally, it prints all combinations. This approach avoids recursion and is more efficient because it avoids the overhead of recursive function calls.
